messages.title: Standing With Theresa May
messages.content: David Mowat pledges to work with Prime Minister Theresa May to deliver the best result for the UK from Brexit.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: David has led the charge to promote apprenticeships in Warrington, with over 300 young people starting apprenticeships since 2010.
David has secured funding for new bypass routes and bridge projects to ease congestion around Warrington.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's important to remember that a vote for anyone other than my local candidate risks Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister of a shambolic coalition government.

issues.brexitEurope: David has pledged to work with Prime Minister Theresa May to deliver the result of the EU Referendum.
issues.transport: David secured funding to ease traffic around the A56-end A57 intersection.

community.content: David has secured funding for new bypass routes and bridge projects to ease congestion around local community.

endorsements.endorsement: David has been a positive force, helping secure funding for local projects in Warrington South.

images.caption: David Mowat pictured with constituents and Theresa May.

examples: Over 300 young people have started an apprenticeship in Warrington since 2010.
It's important to remember that a vote for anyone other than my local candidate risks Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister of a shambolic coalition government.
David has led the charge to promote apprenticeships in Warrington.
David secured funding to ease traffic around the A56-end A57 intersection.
David has pledged to work with Prime Minister Theresa May to deliver the result of the EU Referendum.
Theresa May endorses David Mowat, highlighting his positive impact in Warrington South.
It's important to remember that a vote for anyone other than my local candidate risks Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister of a shambolic coalition government.
Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister of a shambolic coalition government.
Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister of a shambolic coalition government.
David Mowat has been actively working on local project funding since 2010.
